ovdesc.p: This Application allows the user to setup any number of margining methods to be used in the revaluation suite. Each method can be associated with a revaluation/margin method black box routine. (See the Manual)

This application allows the user to define a number of extra parameters of there choice to be passed into the black box routine as well as a series of extra factors to apply to any results being produced by a black box.
NO.IM - Used in order to skip producing any Initial margin for a group of trades.
NO.VM - Used in order to skip producing any Variation margin for a group of trades.
STAND.IM - Provides the standard Initial Margin Calculation.
STAND.VM - Provides the standard Varitaion Margin Calculation.
ENHANCED - Provides an enhanced Initial Margin Calculation.

This allows the user to associate a data name (variable) to a piece of data to be passed to a particular revaluation black box. Such as
CONS.DATA.NAME : RISK.FACTOR CONS.DATA.ITEM: 35
When processing the black box the box is provided with the information that RISK.FACTOR = 35.

This information can be extracted from a common array called R.RVC.DATA by locating the text in array position DX.RVD.DATA.NAME, this will identify where in the DX.RVD.DATA.ITEM position the data value is stored.
This field also has a number of online substitutions available.
!TODAY - Provides the current bank date in internal T24 format, e.g. 20020205.
!NWD - Provides the next working day of the current company in internal T24 format, e.g. 20020206.
!LWD - Provides the last working day of the current company in internal T24 format, e.g. 20020204.
!WHO - Provides the ID of the current operator, e.g. TRAIN01.
